section.12: The Book of The At-Tatbiq (Clasping One's Hands Together)

hadiths.text: Anas bin Malik said:"I have never seen anyone whose prayer more closely resembles the prayer of the Messenger of Allah (ï·º) than this young man- meaning 'Umar bin Abdul-aziz. And we estimated that when bowing he said the Tasbih ten times and when prostrating he said the Tasbih ten times
